{{Quote|I am his and he is mine, from this day until the end of my days.|Talisa Stark|Valar Morghulis}}
[[Robb Stark]] who has been proclaimed [[King in the North]] meets [[Talisa Maegyr]] a battle field healer after the [[Battle of Oxcross]], in [[Season 2]], in the episode "[[Garden of Bones]]". Despite the fact that he has entered a marriage contract with [[House Frey]], Robb comes to love her.
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, there is no character named Talisa. Robb marries Jeyne Westerling whom he meets at the Crag. She is described as slender, with brown eyes, chestnut curls, and a heart shaped face. [[House Westerling|The Westerlings]] are an old Westeros house and descend from the [[First Men]], but Jeyne did have [[Maggy|a great-grandmother]] who came from [[Essos]]. The Westerlings are bannermen of the Lannisters, and Robb leads the storming of their castle. He is wounded in the arm and Jeyne nurses him. It is not said that she has actual medical training, though her mother Sybell was taught to make potions by [[Maggy|Jeyne's great-grandmother]] the "maegi". Robb is there recuperating when word comes about the deaths of [[Bran Stark|Bran]] and [[Rickon Stark|Rickon]]. Jeyne comforts him and they have sex. Despite his betrothal promise to House Frey, RobbÂ marries Jeyne to spare herÂ from disgrace after having taken her virginity, seeing it as the honorable thing to do.Â Jeyne's parents had surrendered to him, but with the marriage, they now acknowledge him as king. When Robb returns to Riverrun to confront his mother about releasing Jaime Lannister, he is less harsh with her as he himself has also been reckless in the breaking of his marriage alliance. Their marriage is not done in secret. Catelyn chides Robb for breaking the pact with the Freys, and he admits his mistake, but the damage cannot be undone, no matter how much they try to appease the Freys.

Jeyne was not present at the [[Red Wedding]], remaining at Riverrun with the [[Brynden Tully|Blackfish]]. ItÂ later transpired that the most of the Westerlings, Jeyne's mother and uncle in particular,Â were involved in the Red Wedding at Tywin Lannister's order, though JeyneÂ appeared unaware and her brother Rayland was genuinely loyal to the Starks (which cost his life when he tried to save Grey Wind). The family was pardoned for their planned "betrayal" and welcomed back peacefully, and was well rewarded for their part in bringing the Starks down.
sections.Background:
Robb Stark is heir to [[Lord Eddard Stark]] of [[Winterfell]]. His father goes to [[King's Landing]] with Robb's two sisters, [[Sansa Stark|Sansa]] and [[Arya Stark|Arya]], in order to serve as [[Hand of the King]] to [[Robert Baratheon]]. When [[Catelyn Stark]] (formerly [[House Tully|Tully]]) takes [[Tyrion Lannister]] captive and charges him with murder. [[House Lannister|Lannister]] forces begin attacking the [[Riverlands]]. This fighting is the opening round of the [[War of the Five Kings]]. Eddard Stark learns that Robert Baratheon's heirs, including [[Joffrey Baratheon|Prince Joffrey]], are the products of an adulterous relationship between [[Jaime Lannister|Jaime]] and [[Cersei Lannister]]. On the death of King Robert, Lord Eddard tries to secure the throne for the true heir [[Stannis Baratheon]], and he is subsequently arrested for treason. Robb, as acting [[Lord of Winterfell]], calls up his bannermen when he learns of the arrest of his father and is marching them south into the Riverlands in order to confront the armies of the Lannister forces.

Talisa Maegyr is a healer from [[Volantis]], one of the free cities of [[Essos]]. It is a city where nobility is important. Rulers must be able to trace their ancestry back to the days of [[Valyria]]. [[Maegyr family|Maegyr]] is an old and noble house. Slavery is legal and forms the basis of the economy. When she was young Talisa spent her days learning to dance, recite poetry, and play the harp. She was expected to lead the frivolous life of a noble women, but when her brother nearly drowns and is saved by a slave, she decides to dedicate her life to something worthwhile and takes up the study of medicine. She has come to [[Westeros]], because she has promised herself to never again live in a place where slavery is accepted.

[[The North]] was once an independent kingdom, until the invasion of Westeros by [[Aegon I Targaryen|Aegon Targaryen]] 300 years ago. Not being able to face the [[House Targaryen|Targaryen's]] dragons in battle led to [[Torrhen Stark]] , King in the North, to renounce his crown and swear fealty.
